intro: Platystele gyroglossa, commonly known as the spiral-tongue platystele, is a rare and unique epiphytic plant native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its striking, spiral-shaped inflorescence that gives it its common name. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
